result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven C. Poler III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 28 days only if revoked.
Concurrent with: 13CF181

miscConds.notes: Paid at no less then $200.00/month commencing upon the first day of the month following release from incarceration.

The defendant must obtain his GED.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.

The defendant may not have any contact nor enter onto any premises of the Mole Lake BP Gas Station.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must file a State and Federal income tax on or before April 15th of each year and provide a copy to P&P agent and the defendant must surrender any tax refunds due him until restitution is paid in full.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.20.
Must be completed within the first 6 months.

supervisions.notes:
All costs and or restitution to be taken from any prison wages or accounts at the maximum amount. Any amounts not paid from prision wages/accounts will become condition of extended supervision.
Concurrent with: 13CF181 & 15CF47

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven C. Poler III

records.addlTxt: Revoked - sentenced to prison
Undecided

02:49 PM Defendant Steven C. Poler appears in person, in custody from FC jail with attorney Breanna Magallones.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video. Called 13CF181, 14CF87 and 15CF47. State here for SEHR. Magallones has received revocation packet, reviewed with Poler and states no inaccuracies. State notes no inaccuracies or errors. Court notices DOC did not make a recommendation in one of the cases. State is recommending a total of 6 years of initial confinement and 6 years of extended supervision. On 13CF181 - count 2 - 9 years consisting of 4 years of initial incarceration followed by 5 years of extended supervision. In case 14CF87 -  count 1 - 3 years consisting of 2 years on initial incarceration followed by 1 year of extended supervision, concurrent to 15CF47 but consecutive to 13CF181. In 15CF47 - counts 3 & 9 - 3 years consisting of 2 years of initial incarceration followed by 1 year of extended supervision, concurrent to each other but consecutive to case 13CF181. Believes count one in 15CF47 that the court mentioned, defendant may have been discharged on that count already (only probation). Court reviews revocation summary and agrees, only revoked on counts 3 & 9. State makes statement, recites criminal history, asks court to follow recommendation, believes there are 584 days credit and confirms victim rights have been complied with. Magallones makes statement, asking for lower amount of time, notes state is asking for more time than the DOC recommendation which the are asking for on 15CF47 - 2 years of incarceration and 1 year of extended supervision. In 13CF181 - 4 years of incarceration and 2 years of extended supervision. In 14CF87 - 2 years of incarceration and 1 year of extended supervision. Asks for non consecutive sentence, has substantial restitution which he intends to pay, asks to make him eligible for programming for reasons as stated on the record, Magallones is asking for a total sentence of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of extended supervision and asking for all cases to run concurrent. Court questions restitution. Magallones makes statement in regards to restitution and paying it through a longer time of extended supervision. Poler makes statement, remorseful. Court - has reviewed revocation packet, considered all statements of parties, makes statement and sentences to the following: 
15CF47 - Counts 3 & 9 - imposes 3 years of imprisonment, consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 1 year of extended supervision, concurrent to each other - gives credit of 200 days, any remaining costs on this case.
13CF181 - Count 2 - imposes 9 years of imprisonment consisting of 4 years of incarceration followed by 5 years of extended supervision, concurrent to cases 14CF87 and 15CF47, gives 204 days of credit, any remaining costs on this case.
14CF87 - Count 1 - imposes 3 years of imprisonment, consisting of 2 years of initial confinement, followed by 1 year of extended supervision, concurrent to 15CF47 - 589 days credit - pay restitution and costs that has not been paid. All costs and restitution is to be taken from any prison wages or accounts at the maximum amount authorized, any amounts not paid in prison will become condition of extended supervision. Court does not make him eligible for any programming. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 9, 2021 at 02:30 pm.

09:25 AM Defendant Steven C. Poler in court with attorney Attorney Breanna Magallones.  Defendant Steven C. Poler in custody from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 13CF181, 14CF87 and 15CF47. State - set for SEHR on each case, believes there will be a request for adjournment. Magallones just received summary yesterday, has not been able to review with client, would like time to go over the revocation packet and asks for an adjournment. Court will allow adjournment, sets all three cases for September 9, 2021 at 2:30 PM. Court notices there may be victims in cases. State will check. Court explains may not be in courthouse, explains where the court maybe held and advises Poler of his right to appear in person.
for sentencing hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven C. Poler in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Steven C. Poler in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:13 PM. Also called 15CF47, 14CF87 and 15CM27. State - 15CF47 - here for INIT and other matters are all resolved. 15CF47 - Burns and Poler have complaint, waives reading of it, set for PH, requests signature bond for stated reasons. State - no objections. Court - bond - modify bond to $2000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and no contact with Sheena Tuckwab, sets for PH. State - 15CM27 - plead g/nc to #1 as alleged with court costs only, #2 - amend to city ordinance of obstructing (9.946.41) with a fine of $500 plus costs; 14CF87 - plead G to only count; 13CF181 - #1 - DRI, #2 - plead G as alleged, joint recommendation of 6 years probation with conditions of: 14CF87 - 1 year conditional jail, court costs on each count on each case, same probation conditions of: AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no entry into any taverns or bars, no contact with Mole Lake BP Gas Station, 14CF87 extra conditions include - restitution of $20,882.01 to Sokoagon Chippewa Community - $2,088.20 VW Surcharge totalling $22,970.21 - make payments of no less than $200.00/month commencing first of month after release from incarceration, file State and federal income tax returns each year and provide copy to P&P agent and surrender any possible refunds. Court asks if the defendant is stipulating to the ability to pay the restitution. State has complied with victim notification requirements. Burns and Poler agree. Court - 13CF181 - courts dismisses and reads in count #1, Tuckwab pleads G to count #2 as alleged. Court - 15CM27 - Tuckwab pleads G to count #1 as alleged, Court amends count #2 to City of Crandon ordinance of obstructing contrary to 9.946.41, pleads G, finds G, fine of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - paid at rate of $50.00/month commencing one month after release from incarceration or 1 month after obtains employment while incarcerated. Court - 14CF87 - Tuckwab pleads G to only count as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendations on all matters. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation on all matters. Tuckwab makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 14CF87 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 6 years with conditions of: 1 year in FC jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.20, 100 hours of community service on 14CF87 only and to be completed within the first 6 months, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, obtain GED, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, court costs - paid thru probation, restitution total of $22,970.21 with VW surcharge - paid thru probation and paid at no less than $200.00/month commencing on the first day of the month upon release from incarceration, no contact and no entry onto the premises of the Mole Lake BP Gas Station, file State and Federal tax returns each year on or before 4/30/15 and provide a copy to P&P agent and surrender any possible refunds until restitution is paid in full, no contact with Mole Lake BP Gas Station; 15CM27 - court costs only - paid at same rate as count #2 in same case; 13CF181 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 6 years, concurrent to 14CF87, with same conditions except no additional jail time, community service or restitution, court costs - paid thru probation, credit for ? on 14CF87 only if revoked, apply any bond on 14CF87 towards restitution and the bond on 13CF181 - apply to costs, no possession of firearms and voting rights, submit DNA sample with surcharge assessed - paid thru probation, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial at 04-08-2015 02:00 pm
No entry onto the premises of the Mole Lake C-Store.

Defendant Steven C. Poler in court via video from FOSO with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Steven C. Poler in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Steven C. Poler in court via video from FOSO with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Steven C. Poler in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:16 AM. Also called 14CF87 and 13CF181. Burns has complaints but has not gone over the new one with the defendant. Poler does not have copy of 15CM27. Court reads penalties and charges. Burns waives further reading and enters NG pleas on all counts. Bail/Bond Reiview. Burns has same position on bond, defendant will be residing at 913 North Hazeldell Avenue, Crandon, WI 54520. State - no objections but concerns on the living address. Court - reduces each case (14CF87 and 13CF181) to $250.00 cash on each case with same conditions and both those cases also set for FPT on same date and time as 15CM27.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Steven C. Poler, in custody and in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also called 13CF181. Called at 2:53 p.m. Both preliminary hearings will be waived. State has provided Information which mirrors the complaint. Court goes through waiver. Defendant has freely, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to preliminary hearing. Finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Continue to arraignment. Enters NG pleas to all counts in both cases. Bond - Burns asks for reduction of bond, $500 cash total between both cases. State - would like more than $500 cash. Court - continues bond. Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Steven C. Poler in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Steven C. Poler in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:56 AM. Also called 13CF181. Burns - believes the defendant has Tom Roley on 13CF181 and she was appointed on 14CF87. Poler has complaint as does Burns. Court reads charges and penalties. Poler understands charges and penalties. Burns asks for PH and waives further reading. Court sets for PH. State - bond - $1000 cash. Burns - no objections. Court - bond - $1000 cash bond, not to enter onto the premises of the Mole Lake C-Store. On 13CF181 - defendant failed to appear for PH on 2/5/14 and has Roley on this matter. Poler wasn't aware that he had Roley. Court discharging Roley from this case and appoints Mary Burns on this matter, set for PH on same date and time. Burns - bond - $2000 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance at 02-11-2015 10:00 am
